title: 5 Things To Know: June 27, 2025
content: Five things to know ahead of the opening bell. A new look at the Fed's preferred measure of inflation, core PCE data is due at 8:30 Eastern time. Economists expecting a year-over-year increase of 2.6%. Up a bit from April. Tesla CEO Elon Musk firing the EV makers vice president of manufacturing operations. summary:
This report outlines five significant developments across finance, technology, media, and celebrity news. In the economic sphere, markets anticipate the release of core PCE data, the Fed's preferred inflation measure, which economists project to show a 2.6% year-over-year increase, a slight uptick from April's figures. This data is expected at 8:30 Eastern time, setting the tone for the opening bell.

Corporate news features major changes at Tesla, where CEO Elon Musk has reportedly fired the vice president of manufacturing operations, a detail gleaned from internal organizational charts viewed by CNBC. The media landscape also sees shifts, with the American edition of Vogue Magazine seeking a new head of editorial content. This role was previously held for decades by Anna Wintour, who will transition to chief content officer at Condé Nast and global editorial director at Vogue. Additionally, Uber is in discussions with co-founder Travis Kalanick regarding potential funding for his acquisition of the U.S. subsidiary of Chinese company Pony AI, as reported by the New York Times.

Finally, the report highlights a high-profile celebrity event: Amazon founder Jeff Bezos and his fiancée Lauren Sanchez have arrived in Venice, Italy, for their extravagant wedding, rumored to cost over 50 million euros/dollars. The couple, observed leaving the luxury Aman Hotel with extensive security, is expected to marry 'today' on the picturesque island of San Giorgio, located directly opposite St. Mark's. The event is anticipated to be a 'big wedding weekend' with approximately 200 confirmed guests, including renowned figures such as Mick Jagger, Ivanka Trump (with her husband Jared), Oprah Winfrey, and Bill Gates.

key_points.text: Five things to know are presented ahead of the opening bell.
The Fed's preferred measure of inflation, core PCE data, is due.
Core PCE data is due at 8:30 Eastern time.
Economists are expecting a year-over-year increase of 2.6% for core PCE.
The expected core PCE increase is slightly up from April's data.
Tesla CEO Elon Musk has fired the EV maker's vice president of manufacturing operations.
The information about the Tesla firing is based on internal organizational charts viewed by CNBC.
The American edition of Vogue Magazine is set to hire a new head of editorial content.
Anna Wintour held the head of editorial content job for decades.
Anna Wintour will remain chief content officer at Condé Nast.
Anna Wintour will also remain global editorial director at Vogue.
Uber is in discussions with its co-founder Travis Kalanick.
The discussions with Kalanick are about potential funding for his acquisition.
Kalanick's acquisition is of the US subsidiary of Chinese company Pony AI.
This information about Uber, Kalanick, and Pony AI is according to a New York Times report.
Amazon founder Jeff Bezos and his fiancée Lauren Sanchez have arrived in Venice, Italy.
Their wedding is reportedly costing over 50 million euros or dollars.
The event is described as a 'big wedding weekend'.
Bezos and Sanchez were seen departing the luxury Aman Hotel with security boats.
They are expected to be married today.
The wedding location is the small island of San Giorgio.
San Giorgio island is located just across from St. Mark's.
Approximately 200 guests are confirmed to be attending the wedding.
Mick Jagger is among the confirmed guests.
Ivanka Trump and her husband Jared are among the confirmed guests.
Oprah Winfrey is among the confirmed guests.
Bill Gates is among the confirmed guests.
